>>cfe90c4c-3bc1-478c-9da3-6b7fe4296b1b
I have not thought about a good way of implementing that so [code] tags are not working right now.

I thought about replacing the format system with a Markdown -> HTML converter but it would significantly increase the complexity of sanitizing the viewer output.
What is /a/ watching this season?

The board list no longer considers blacklisted posts as valid posts.

>>6e499a7a-2bc3-4d26-b129-f10a9fcb5651

>>0ca57c50-a36d-4a24-badc-d98547b6e1a5
It sounds interesting but I'm unsure how expensive it would be to have multiple thumbnails being created concurrently.
We may need a semaphore to limit the amount of concurrent work being done.

>By the way do you accept PRs?
Sure. You can create a merge request in the GitGud repo if you want.
I won't see them, and therefore won't be able to accept it, if you post in the Git Center repo.

>>8c0d6a3b-85c5-4cf3-b0b0-90d6940c844e
Made some [modifications](https://gitgud.io/mcdev/Millchan/commit/d0022bb17bd733d3dfa98285175abbef87bff085).
Resizing should be executing in the worker now but all work is still being done sequentially.

Not sure if code splitting is still working with this new loader so I'll have to wait for other people to try to post to see if things are still working.

It sounds like it's just your computer swapping things from main memory to disk.
If that's the case you won't find the "app" that is causing the lag since it's the operating system that is doing that.
You may try adjusting your swappiness value to see if it will have any effect

>>fc329692-6f34-4943-8e09-351aaed1025b

A hub owner should be able to edit/delete any posts in the same way an user an edit/delete their own posts here.
After defining how this system will work it will be straight-forward to add other things like allowing stickies and defining a custom CSS.

>I'd like to help developing it.
Feel free to open a PR to this branch.

But you're right about there being some benefits with having separate content.json files for the mods/users.

>>6394caf1-0d5d-49e9-a242-e633a9e44c17
>Is there a way for me to set labels or can only you do it?
I changed your role permission.
You should be able to manage labels and do a few other things now.
>The way I'm doing it right now is deleting my fork and forking the repo again, which doesn't feel right.
The usual flow is to create separate branches for those.
Ideally you would have a "merger" branch that is read-only and the only way that it is updated is by pulling from the repository.
If you need to make modifications to solve an issue you would create a new branch from your read-only branch and then create the merge request from that.
>What do you use to develop?
Nothing fancy. Just a basic text editor with no plugins.
But I will probably try something else once we start using linters to enforce the same style throughout the code.

I hear Visual Studio Code is decent **if you don't mind sending your data to MS.**

>>af797d6d-92c0-42c7-b8ee-fb247547b815

>>bb34ba77-9e54-46fd-b886-fc6dd90bf1d9

Apparently there is a rare bug in ZeroNet that is making all the original files in a post inaccessible.
The size of each file it's not displayed in those cases for the people trying to download it (pic related) but I assume OP is able to see the size of each file he posted in >>529a2bc0-16c6-4547-b5dd-637acacbeb81

Work in my machine.
Which browser you're using?

Also, post the JS network log of when click the "Download all" button and see if there are any errors in the console.

>>d1c4dd7b-c8c8-4faa-b026-d3f64cd2d6bc
>firefox
Ok. Thanks. I was able to reproduce now.

And yes it was working before.
It seems related to a change in ZeroNet.
This [commit](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/commit/e4819c175307fa8d65ba8c64716bd94319c0a55a) made the CSP rules stricter which is affecting those requests in Firefox due to the way they implemented the CSP.

I don't think there is JS workaround for this.
I opened an issue in ZeroNet and we'll have to wait and see if anything will  be done about it.

In the meantime, a safer workaround than completely disabling CSP is to modify the headers that ZeroNet is returning and add `blob:` to the `frame-src` directive.

>>5a2fa7f0-8f2a-4380-847f-11ef173b7291

>>8fc23d7e-c95f-419b-9c48-be6f043f1e32
Not OP but I can guess at some of the things he's referring to:
>no privacy
By default that's accurate. If you publish something in the network anyone will be able to access whatever you have posted.
Nonetheless nothing prevents owners from using cryptography in their sites to make things private (e.g. ZeroMail uses E2E encryption to allow people to send private messages to each other).

>no anonymity
The network relies on a scheme of asymmetric cryptography. The means users have to know each other's public keys to be able to verify the integrity of the content that is being shared.
Hence, if you want to make a post somewhere, it will be necessary to associate the content with a public certificate.
That makes posts pseudo-anonymous since they can be associated to a public key but, in general, the public key cannot be associated to anything else.

There have been some attempts to remove this caveat and make posts completely anonymous by generating a new key-pair after every post but there are currently some limitations in ZeroNet preventing it from working properly.  There is an issue in the GitCenter repository with more info about that.

>no security
Not sure what he's on about but perhaps he means that  things aren't encrypted like Freenet.
Or that ZeroNet's protocol/implementation haven't been audited.
Probably something along those lines.

>>e8491efc-1b38-45c9-b4ae-7545922aaf89

>>e1afc363-dcbf-4ddb-9cfb-a749e7286daf
When you click a filename, to bypass some restrictions, Millchan will fetch the file from disk using the API and turn into a blob to be able to trigger a download prompt using the original filename.
It sounds like you're reaching a limit in the beginning of this process.
Maybe the file is too big for your system or something.

Try saving it with right-click -> Save as.

Left ticked.
Right unticked.

It won't retroactively download files.

Kimetsu no Yaiba if you like shounenshit.

`Help seed the files` will only automatically download new files posted by the user.
The problem you're seeing may be because, for some reason, your client failed to download the files immediately after they've been posted which would result in later retries with exponential backoff. 

>to see that SOME images was downloaded, some not (shows [seed] link)
Sometimes the [Seed] will not be displayed because ZeroNet incorrectly says that a given file has been downloaded.
It's possible. I will work on it.

>>203cccd5-0bb3-4420-bf96-71348023305e
Muting users will make their certificate be blocked in ZeroNet itself.
Those muted users can be managed in ZeroHello in "Manage blocked users and sites" and they can already be shared using shared blacklists.

Blacklisting boards is a Millchan feature that prevents loading content from the blacklisted boards.
They haven't. Try disabling the blacklist / rebuilding your database.

Did you execute the instructions in the README? (i.e. `npm install && npm run dev`)

If you did list the content of the `dist` folder.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lazy_loading

>>4ab68a70-66a5-40eb-a13f-7664e8feebd6
`dist` should contain all the required scripts to run Millchan.
Those scripts are created by npm.

If the folder is empty then you will fail to load any dynamic content for obvious reasons.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/issues/view/?1P4w4Rvh4vS9r6G5xTiSh8qEW87EKZtnJB/0@1Nrjz2bkDJAMcVyPidS2gKLZ4UUyrnQRLe

>>a189d020-ee1f-4c25-8e66-8f4b7cc9dcbf
>difference between "help seed" and "seed all"
`Seed all` makes a [Seed] request for all files in the current post.
`Help seed` automatically downloads all the future files uploaded by the selected user.
See >>c4eee259-16e0-4cfb-bce5-17728e2dea55

>>ac3f4069-24e9-4a35-9512-e7eef6fb602a
>Using firefox and its broken
I literally just told you that.

>going back to 5X and the same problem happens
It wasn't Firefox that changed.
It was ZeroNet. More specifically in [this commit](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/commit/e4819c175307fa8d65ba8c64716bd94319c0a55a).

>Your link is also invalid.
Let me help you with that. This is what you need to know:
[code]
Add "blob:" to "frame-src" CSP rules if Firefox


Firefox doesn't allow to prompt download of blobs because of the current “frame-src” CSP rules.

>Content Security Policy: The page’s settings blocked the loading of a resource at blob:null/6f8287cc-cdc6-4956-80df-ee7bd30ac55e (“frame-src”).

This is necessary to be able to bypass the cross-site restrictions of requests due to the iframe context: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#Attributes

>Although HTTP(s) URLs need to be in the same-origin, blob: URLs and data: URLs are allowed so that content generated by JavaScript, such as pictures created in an image-editor Web app, can be downloaded.
[/code]

If you want to verify that this is actually the issue modify your ZeroNet headers to allow Firefox to execute blobs in the frame-src directive.

>>61d1d7a8-6c2f-4886-b765-1142d3464a4b
>I submitted second comment, nothing appeared, so i submitted third comment, and once done, i see second comment appeared but not third, most recent one... And so on.
I will try checking that again.

>First - leading post disappeared, but others not.
That's by design. If you delete a thread it will not appear in the page/catalog but all its replies will still be visible if you visit its route.
Maybe adding a `[Deleted]` to those threads' OP will make it clear that is it the intended behavior in those cases.

>>76213270-76cc-4383-9800-62f30675746d
Works fine on my machine.
The cases where there will be noticeable performance issues are if you're either opening really large threads or using the Tor bundle browser in the highest security settings.

Moreover, in general, a imageboard like this will always perform worse than regular clearnet imageboards since we cannot take advantage of template caches and everything has to be rendered in the browser.

>>36b46004-4abd-4171-9395-0b97951cbcfb
>>4ad94559-4b62-447b-bf16-d5f7ec37c2c8
A few other basic things that are missing in 08chan that work here:
- Menu to quickly manage files
- Allow usernames
- Allow closing videos
- Post count in the tab title
- Allow sorting in the catalog
- UI translated to other languages
- Allow seeding all files in a post
- Allow seeing only the last "50" replies of the thread
- Improved anti-spam system
 
The most important bugs fixed were:
- Tor white thumbnails for images
- User interaction not being blocked while a board is being blacklisted
- [Seed] not working sometimes
- Other security things

**I also wish they would change to favicon to something else fix the transparency in their logo.**

Maybe things have improved in the Python3 branch but I haven't tested that yet.

>>362cbe1e-894a-49bc-8754-5e0d06dc2258
https://gitgud.io/millchan/Millchan/commit/bb417c3276057766d828778c4ca6fcb565ac5cf4

The easiest solution would be disabling self-signed certificates and only allowing ZeroID or any other trusted CA that cannot be auto-generated.

Another solution that would keep things decentralized would be using a Proof-of-Work based IDs.
See: [https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1258](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1258)

>>a13c0680-025f-4559-b620-5207a0d4dbe7
>How would this be done in the site's main code
Define the @zeroid permission_rules in `data/users/content.json` and update config.js to allow zeroid users.
See the Millchan files for an example.

>what would users need to do to get a ZeroID?
http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroid.bit

If you allow '''only''' ZeroID certificates any posts/boards that were created with other certificates will not be visible anymore.
Also, decreasing the allowed size might be a good idea.

>>c0bcdde6-2423-40e0-ab2f-89e2163fb71e
It could be done in an efficient way but it would be a good idea to limit the amounted of hidden threads to prevent having to load a big list every time the thread is rendered.
Maybe only keep the last 50 hidden threads or something like that.

It should be simple enough but I don't have time to work on it at the moment.

>Does zeronet have to download everything, like a bitcoin node?
It doesn't. The initial sync should only download the required files.
It will only download a lot of files if you enable `DOWNLOAD AND HELP DISTRIBUTE ALL FILES` in the sidebar.

>>3884fd71-807d-4d28-a1cc-02056babbd69
Hub owners already have full control of all data posted in their hubs.
The only thing the engine would do is to give them a convenient interface to be able to manage it in a simple way.

I do agree that we should strive to be as free as possible here but a ZeroNet site doesn't necessarily needs to be run that way.
The decision of censoring content is entirely up to the owner.

In the ideal world all users would just move to another hub if the owner/moderators start abusing their powers.

>>f0ef2e56-b088-441c-8f33-ddd71e187d13
Works on my machine.

>>13cc0ea7-45f7-453a-a6cf-3051caf7f0c5
One way would be to get all the old certificates and create an individual rule for each of them.
If you want to be strict you will probably need to define `max_size` to the current amount of bytes that they've uploaded.

New self-signed certificates outside of that list wouldn't be allowed to upload since they wouldn't be in the permission list and certificates that already exist wouldn't be allowed to post beyond their defined limit.

An issue with this approach is that the accounts in the list could still be used to spam by updating their data.json but in that case it should be trivial to remove those accounts from the list.

>>8b42deec-3ddf-4387-93ff-9ee6d6388558
Probably a syntax error.
Check with a json validator.

There are some tweaks being made to the recent posts list.
It should be fixed today. Thanks for reporting.

>>7f55628f-57e2-48e1-8c33-ce02eed14878
- shutdown ZeroNet
- open ZeroNet/data/sites.json
- find the `1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA` object
- remove all the `bad_files`
- restart ZeroNet

>>94b9961a-1eb7-426a-adbd-402426e16a6f
>imachug describe possible workaround to this issue.
That might help with the case where images fail to load after the user has requested a number a thumbnails but I'm not seeing how it would help in the case that happened with >>7f55628f-57e2-48e1-8c33-ce02eed14878.
The only thing the seed board files button does is to create a `fileNeed` request for each file posted in the selected board.
https://gitgud.io/millchan/Millchan/blob/master/js/millchan/millchan.ts#L445

I assume ZeroNet will eventually give up and stop trying to download "bad files" but it seems it's taking an excessive amount of time/tries sometimes.

>the comment he replied to was renumbered
Yeah that's a consequence of trying to have a number system.
I'm considering the things that can be done to fix this but so far the most suitable solution seems to be removing the number system and relying solely on the UUID.
That would definitely be worse for UX but it would fix that problem and improve the performance overall.

>>d98e51a9-eea2-40b4-a0d7-8d89e3f2e1c0
Yeah probably.
If will only return addresses as names if the certificate authority is different from whatever is defined as the domain (i.e. self signed X certificates are considered to be anonymous on X).

>>33fdd16a-8cee-40df-83ba-73609ef1698e
